definition: to see/to look at/to read/to watch/to visit/to call on/to consider/to regard as/to look after/to treat (an illness)/to depend on/to feel (that)/(after verb) to give it a try/Watch out! (for a danger)
to look after/to take care of/to watch/to guard
Qing or Ch'ing dynasty of imperial China (1644-1911)/surname Qing
clear/distinct/quiet/just and honest/pure/to settle or clear up/to clean up or purge

sentences.english: Unfortunately the photo is a bit dark, so cannot see the reception clearly.
sentences.chinese: 很不幸像片拍得有些暗，所以看不清前台。

sentences.english: Rolling without any knowledge of where he went, Kwuteggrappled another wolf.
sentences.chinese: 看不清自己滚到了哪里，库泰格又抱住了另一头狼。

sentences.english: I wasn't asleep so I couldn't see him clearly.
sentences.chinese: 我当时没带眼睛，我没在睡觉，所以才看不清他。

sentences.english: I find that I can't see the words clearly when the book is close to me.
sentences.chinese: 我发现要是书离得很近，我就看不清上面的字了。

sentences.english: His eyesight is too poor to read such small letters.
sentences.chinese: 他的视力太差了，看不清这么小的字。

sentences.english: The invention solves the problem that the doorplate can not be seen clearly in the darkness.
sentences.chinese: 本发明解决了黑暗中看不清门牌号码的问题。

sentences.english: One has to be blind not to recognize this fact.
sentences.chinese: 一个有眼无珠的人才会看不清这个事实。

sentences.english: Please send the remitter address to us, since we can not read the fax clearly.
sentences.chinese: 请发汇款人地址给我们，因为传真上看不清楚。

sentences.english: During the day, it stopped to have a rest.
sentences.chinese: 白天，当它看不清北斗星的时候，它就停下来休息。

sentences.english: We saw a shape through the mist but we couldn't see who it was.
sentences.chinese: 我们在雾中看到一个模糊的人影，但看不清那是谁。

sentences.english: You can not see my face clearly, because i get it browned again.
sentences.chinese: 你看不清我的脸，是因为我又晒黑了。

sentences.english: For instance, how can a creature be exhibited when it is too small to be seen clearly?
sentences.chinese: 比如，一个小得看不清的生物如何展出呢？

sentences.english: Heavy smoke filled the room, he could hardly find his way out.
sentences.chinese: 房间里尽是烟雾，他几乎看不清出门的路。

sentences.english: Don't look at the corner of the hidden, one is light shallow love note?
sentences.chinese: 在看不清的角落里，藏着的那一个轻浅的爱的附注？

sentences.english: Because he had a disease named congenital cataracts . he cann't go to school .
sentences.chinese: 因为他先天性白内障，看不清文字，也无法拿笔。

sentences.english: It was dark, and we could not make out who was coming along the road.
sentences.chinese: 天黑了，我们看不清是谁向我们走来。

definition: can't see/can't make out/unable to tell
pitch-black/(fig.) to be completely in the dark
variant of 黑糊糊[hei1 hu1 hu1]
pitch-black/(fig.) to be completely in the dark
lit. to look at flowers in the fog (idiom); fig. blurred vision
